title: Current increase in Covid-19 cases not causing strain on healthcare capacity: MOH
description: SINGAPORE — The current increase in Covid-19 cases in Singapore is not causing a strain on healthcare capacity, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) on Monday (March 27) in response to CNA’s queries.

title: Expats baulk at rising rents, as some think twice about staying in Singapore amid intensifying global talent war
description: SINGAPORE — Though he and his family “love living in Singapore” and have been doing so the last seven years, French expatriate Paul will be moving his whole family back to France come June as his landlord intends to raise the rent of his accommodation by 70 per cent.

title: Amid soaring rentals, 7 in 10 firms ready to move expat staff overseas: Survey
description: SINGAPORE — Half of expatriates here have been hit by rental increases of more than 40 per cent, while about seven in 10 businesses are ready to relocate their staff out of Singapore if there is no relief from rising operating costs, a survey has found.

title: Mahathir claims Malays 'lost everything' after he resigned as PM
description: KUALA LUMPUR — Former two-time Malaysian prime minister Mahathir Mohamad claimed on Monday (March 27) that Malays "lost everything" after he resigned from office following the collapse of the Pakatan Harapan (PH) government in February 2020.

title: Baby found lying face down and without breath in nanny's home was left alone for 3 hours: Coroner's court
description: SINGAPORE — A six-month-old baby who was found face down and motionless in a nanny's home had been left alone in a room for three hours, a coroner's court heard on Monday (March 27).

title: Every HDB flat will be a valuable nest egg for retirement, says PM Lee
description: SINGAPORE — Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong on Sunday (March 26) said it was the ruling People's Action Party government's promise that all Housing and Development Board (HDB) flats would be good homes as well as valuable nest eggs for retirement.

title: PM Lee to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping during visit to China
description: SINGAPORE — Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping during his visit to China from March 27 to April 1.

title: When massages become harmful: Here's what you need to know
description: SINGAPORE — It is no secret that people in Singapore love a good massage, judging by the numerous massage places around. To some, it is a panacea for aches and pains, tensed muscles or other stress-induced problems. However, a massage can sometimes go wrong and cause bad side effects.

title: 61-year-old man tasered after allegedly starting fire, charging at police officers with knife
description: SINGAPORE — A 61-year-old man was charged on Saturday (March 25) with possessing an offensive weapon in public, the police said in a news release on Sunday.

title: US bank First Citizens to acquire collapsed Silicon Valley Bank
description: WASHINGTON — US bank First Citizens said on Monday (March 27) it has agreed to purchase much of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), whose collapse this month sparked global fears about the sector.

title: Alibaba founder Jack Ma returns to China, ending year-long sojourn abroad: SCMP
description: BEIJING — Alibaba founder Jack Ma has returned to China, the South China Morning Post (SCMP) reported on Monday (March 27), ending a more than year-long sojourn overseas that was viewed by industry as reflecting the sober mood of China's private businesses.

title: Commentary: Why older workers envy younger colleagues and how to address it
description: In the space of just one week not that long ago, I made some perplexing discoveries about three people I know through work.

title: Commentary: The need for a Singapore 'Blue Plan' to help protect the world's high seas
description: A new treaty agreed on by countries earlier this month could pave the way for better protection of the high seas, which lie beyond 200 nautical miles (370km) from any nation’s coastline.

title: My Southeast Asia Ventures: How I started a health tech firm in Brunei and became friends with ministers there
description: I first went to Brunei Darussalam about three years ago. I had no idea what to expect, but was immediately blown away by the warmth of the people and the natural beauty of the abundant hiking trails and parks. I have been back many times since.

title: Vietnamese housewife who took over hubby’s stall to support 3 kids after he died from cancer wins fans for her fish soup
description: The homemaker was forced to take over Hai Kee Seafood stall when her hawker husband passed away months after his cancer diagnosis. 8days.sg finds her yummy fish soup with thick batang slices good value for money.
keywords: Toa Payoh Lorong 8 Market & Hawker Centre

title: Singaporean songwriter Hubert Ng, 30, wrote this K-pop song that was just released, feels K-pop is  a good market for local composers
description: Always time to #supportlocal.

title: Ex-national footballer Rafi Ali closes his popular Ali Nachia briyani stall
description: “We’re sad but life is like that lah, things must come to an end,” says Rafi, whose father started the family-run stall at the old Tanjong Pagar Railway Station in 2002.

title: Insta-buzz: What the stars were up to this week
description: Here are some of our favourite snaps from the past week.

title: To achieve FIRE, don’t rely on the spark of speculation
description: Financial independence and early retirement are popular goals for millennials and Gen Z workers – but getting there requires steady financial habits, not risky investments.

title: Helping SMEs to continuously develop their talent through learning and development
description: Jason Marine Group’s partnership with NTUC LearningHub brings both company and employees to the next level.
